rComments: He's really nice.

This guy rocks! His interpretations of the plays we read were fun, insightful, easy to undrestand and he really made these gruesome 15-16th century plays seem like contemporary comedies. He was always open to our interpretations and his essays were not hard to write. Overall he made me want to come to class.
This man is the most boring lecturer. Ever. Period. Attendance was useless, readings were useless, section was useless, class was useless. He isn't rocking  the mullet and fanny pack anymore, either.

Overall I really enjoyed this call. Jones is very enthusiastic and I thought lectures were pretty entertaining. If you're not a huge Shakespeare fan you may find discussion tedious at times. Exams were a little long with some tricky questions so you do need to study and read! Don't expect an easy A but is a rewarding class if you put in the time.

Intro to Shakespeare was one of the most enjoyable classes I took last year. Lots of play reading (obviously) and analysis (obviously), and I'd read several of the plays before but Jones made it worth coming to class. Not much interaction with him, because it was a big class, but I'd like to take a smaller class with him sometime.

Could poetic analysis get any more boring? Seriously, after you analyze poetry for two weeks you pretty much have it down, let alone if you're a lit major. I felt like we learned the same thing every day, and very little knowledge is actually gained. But, not bad for PR if you're a modern lit major like me. And he's a sweet guy, which is good too.
class was okay, but professor is rather boring. the tests make up the majority of your grade, so you must do well on them. no extra credit, and one paper that barely counts for anything.

If you like Tolkien style fantasy and Shakespeare's writing style, then take this class by all means! Willy Jones is a very likeable, happy-go-lucky guy. The workload is light, and Willy grades easy. Reccomended for any lit major.

This class is amazing. I love Dr. Jones, he is still sporting a fanny pack and is hilarious. He makes the funniest facial expressions and he blushes sooo much whenever the illusion to male or female genitalia comes up, expecially the topic of sex. He makes this stuff fun and he keeps you engaged. If you stay on top of the reading your golden!

Class is so general, I felt like I was taking AP English Lit all over again. If you're a Lit Major, it'd be more worth it to take Lit 1 with a more specific focus so it isn't all stuff you probably know already. Lectures were fine, interest and development in class really depends on your TA. Jovial guy, overall pretty easy to do well.
He is so jolly.  The class was easy and his lectures were clear and pretty interesting.  But he's mostly into pre- and early modern lit, which I found to be boring.

He is a good teacher. He can be funny. As for easiness- it all depends on who your TA is because they grade ALL your work.  I missed a few classes and I don't feel like I was too far behind because I went to section. It definitely wasn't my favorite course but it satisfied my W so whatever. it could have been MUCH worse.

One of the most boring, uninteresting classes I have ever taken! They assigns grades for participation when there are no sections and 200 people in the class. Also, the final was extremely difficult and the TA are rediculous and unintelligent. Jones also sports a fanny-pack and a mullet if that means ANYTHING to anyone!
He's really entertaining and clear. He tries to make an A accessible to every student. Very helpful.

This class is great if you actually enjoy reading the plays. If you read them, and miss out on some of the readings, you can still do very well. You only write one short paper for the quarter. Professor Jones is funny and entertaining, and film clips on fridays are something to look foward too. If you enjoy reading and Shakes. this is an easy A!

As long as you go to classes, this course is very enjoyable. The prof is animated and makes Shakespeare accessable, teaching students how to read, translate, and analyze Shakespearian texts. I didn't read Henry V and still did well on the test because in class he drills everything you need to know. Class is well-structured w/ mix of movies & text.

Awesome teacher!  I am following this guy to another of his classes for certain!  A great teacher and very friendly, cute, approachable, and funny.  Satire is an AWESOME class in general.  It's so interesting the difficuly level is negigible.  Very enjoyable lectures.

so damn funny and very enjoyable to listen to.  i definitely felt as thought i learned a good amount in this class and had a good time doing it.  i think it's awesome that he actually made it to the government's blacklist post-9/11 because "They" were suspicious of his subversive attitude towards their, um, ****.  awesome.

I had this guy for three classes. I kept following him because he is the most approachable prof on campus. Take his Satire class if you get the chance! Not easy, but   WELL WORTH IT. Also took Shakespeare and 17th century poetry with him. Thanx Professor Jones!

Animated guy. However, he didn't really go into depth enough. The worst was the front row of people asking him really obvious questions and repeating what he just said as if they came up with it. It was all very sad actually.
No Comments
Great attitude and very funny.  Interesting lectures, he is a good speaker.

Very interesting class if you're interested in Shakespeare. Lectures were clear, though not all that in-depth with the primary reading (most of it was from the secondary reading). Jones is entertaining and knowledgable, as well as very helpful.

Best class taken so far. GREAT texts, fun class, super nice guy. Just go to lectures and mark what he says and you will do fine. He's approachable, encouraging, and really loves what he's doing. Did I mention you should take this class?
super knowledgable about british poetry, funny, energetic, etc. don't do the reading before class; come to class, mark the sonnets that are discussed and you'll do just fine.

Jonesy blushes a lot and refuses to say a certain word that begins with a C and ends with a T and refers to a female body part, even when it's projected behind him. However, he's still good at pointing out the erotic connotations of every sonnet ever.

i like him. he knows what hes talking about, provides good insight, gives you new perspectives, and shows film clips... gives a good all around view of shakespeare and his times. hes also kind of funny and i havent slept through 1 lecture. straightforward, you know what will be on the test, very fair, fun, and a cool class.

What an amazing professor.  His love for Shakespeare is infectious and he sets up the class so that you are eased into the different plays and get better at reading Victorian English as you go.  Rusty is the sh*t.  He could drink you under the table (Not sure, but I am almost positive) and then discuss the transformation of Henry V (Hal to Henry).

UNBEARABLE class. it made me want to die. jones (a nice guy) was repetitive and his lectures were shallow and uninsightful. everything he said was taken directly from the supplementary texts. what was worse was hearing students ask him his opinion with reverence as if his thoughts were any more valuable than their own or mine or the mailman's

One of the worst teachers I've had. His lectures skimmed the surface of the material, not once, NOT ONCE, getting into the interesting substance in the sonnets or plays. His name is synonymous with ineptness and boredom within the major. I would fell asleep in his class on a daily basis and missed NOTHING. A terrible terrible experience. Avoid him.
Two words: Motherf@#$ing ADORABLE.  Jonesy has really bad fashion sense, and gets WAY too excited about Shakespeare, but he's nice, intelligent, and his tests are very easy.  A+++

Jonesy: what an amazing professor.  Very passionate, dedicated, approachable.  The man is a walking dictionary and encyclopedia.  Very well organized lectures/ fair tests/ fun paper assignments.  One of the best teachers I've had here.

I hated this class. I thought his lectures were boring and he emphasized too much on memorizing authors. The paper topics were fair and most of the tests were too. I wouldn't recommend this class to someone just getting into literature, although I would say the 2nd half was better than the 1st.

Jonesy loves his water bottle and the sound of his own voice. Although I must say his mullet is one of the most sophisticated I've seen. The material was interesting and the man did know what he teaching. A fantastically good time with Jones.
excellent.  dr. jones is extremely approachable and helpful, gave interesting, relevant, and well organized lectures, and is incredibly knowledgable.
